name: Entertainer
description: Ability Scores Strength, Dexterity, Charisma Feat Musician Skill Proficiencies Acrobatics and Performance Tool Proficiency Choose one kind of Musical Instrument Equipment Choose A or B: (A) Musical Instrument (same as above), 2 Costumes, Mirror, Perfume, Traveler’s Clothes, 11 GP; or (B) 50 GP You spent much of your youth following roving fairs and carnivals, performing odd jobs for musicians and acrobats in exchange for lessons. You may have learned how to walk a tightrope, how to play a lute in a distinct style, or how to recite poetry with impeccable diction. To this day, you thrive on applause and long for the stage.

name: Envoy of the Free Peoples
description: You serve your people and perhaps a particular lord or household as a diplomat and an ambassador. You travel the length and breadth of Eredane, with the authority to speak on behalf of your people within the most secure halls of their allies. Among your own people, you hold a position of honor and respect. To the other free peoples, you are a symbol of future alliances and distant hope. Yet, to Izrador and his armies, you are a threat to be eradicated. Your role requires that you carry some mark of authority and license, bestowed upon you by your lord or people. This often takes the form of an object like a signet ring, a written letter, or a rod of office, but it can also be something more subtle like an easily hidden tattoo or brand. Should this mark ever be discovered by the Shadow’s forces, your life would be in great danger. Should it be taken from you, the evil use they could put it to would be unthinkable. Skill Proficiencies: History, Persuasion Languages: Two of your choice Equipment: A set of traveler’s clothes, a set of fine clothes, a mark of your lords proxy (a signet ring or some other trinket that guarantees the authenticity of your service), a pouch containing 15gp Feature: Diplomatic Sanctuary Your mission frequently takes you into the realms of other free peoples and through the hostile territory that separates them. Should your mission be known to them, the free peoples of Eredane will welcome you into their safe havens and, should your mission require it, even to the audience of their lords and ladies. Suggested Characteristics Envoys are shaped by a life of great responsibility and danger. Their role demands that they work to form strong bonds between peoples and nations, yet they spend most of their lives separated from their own people. d8 Personality Trait 1 I never back down when the freedom and safety of the weak is at stake. 2 I use humor to relieve the stress that comes from my role against the Shadow. 3 I often share food and resources with others. 4 I have a tendency to brag about my exploits when around others sympathetic to the cause. 5 I find it hard to stay my blade when the enemy harms others, but it would be imprudent or deadly for me to intervene. 6 I have a love for life that sometimes comes off as innocence but is actually forged from hardship. 7 I enjoy being the underdog. 8 I hold my head high and refuse to weep for those lost in the fight. d6 Ideal 1 Freedom. The fight against Izrador's shackle is what is most important in life. (Chaotic) 2 Community. The dream of rebuilding a world after the passing of the Shadow keeps me in the fight. (Lawful) 3 Life. Saving even one life makes every sacrifice worthwhile. (Good) 4 Hatred. The atrocities committed by Izrador and his forces have motivated me to see them suffer. (Evil) 5 Wealth. Living on the run, tithing, and never having been able to really get ahead give me fantasies of living the good life if and when we are victorious. (Neutral) 6 Grit. After seeing so much suffering, fighting seemingly impossible battles, and losing so much, I have to keep going by sheer will and resolve. (Neutral) d6 Bond 1 As I held a loved one, dying in my arms, I vowed to avenge them. 2 A legate in charge of collecting tithes from my village suspects that I may be up to something. 3 My companions mean everything to me and I would do anything for them. 4 Something important to me or my family was taken by a legate. When I have the strength, I will take it back. 5 Everything I have comes from the town that raised me. I intend to pay them back tenfold. 6 A childhood friend chose to join Izrador's forces. I know there is good in them and I intend to win them back. d6 Flaw 1 I quickly lose my temper and, when I do, make decisions that may put myself or others in danger. 2 I can be stingy and protective of my belongings. 3 I am less brave in the face of the enemy than my peers. 4 I will lie, cheat, and steal in order to survive. 5 I sometimes give too much of myself in order to help others. 6 Deep in my heart, I know all is lost. I am sometimes overcome by my melancholy.

name: Ex-enforcer
description: You use violence so that powerful people can get what they want. Whether it’s for cops, cartels, or corporations, in exchange for a little bit of their power and a little bit of their money, you hurt who they tell you to. The work isn’t all dubious—you’re often up against people that are at least as bad as your boss—but when your boss sends you to shake down shopkeepers or punch protesters, you follow orders. As long as you and yours are fine, you don’t care. When you choose this background, work with your GM to determine who you worked for and what kind of work they had you do. Are you adventuring at their behest, or did you have a falling out? Skill Proficiencies: Intimidation, Perception Tool Proficiencies: One type of gaming set, vehicles (land) Equipment: A symbol of your boss’s authority, a well-worn cudgel (club), manacles, a waterskin of strong ale, a set of common clothes, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp Maybe you decided that hurting innocent people for money wasn’t for you. Maybe you weren’t given the choice. Regardless, you no longer work for a boss. If you left on good terms, other enforcers still view you as one of their own. If you switched sides, you gain the benefit of One of Many from the people you formerly oppressed, instead of other enforcers. This should be a specific group, such as dockworkers or slum residents. Choose how you left your boss’s employ, or roll on the table below. D6 Turning Point 1 I was ordered to hurt a childhood friend and was fired when I refused. 2 I realized that I could make more money fighting for myself. 3 The boss died and a power struggle ripped their organization apart. 4 Another enforcer got hurt, and instead of taking care of them, the boss kicked them to the curb. 5 A job went wrong and a rival enforcer set me up to take the fall. 6 One day I woke up and I couldn’t look at myself in the mirror anymore. Feature: One of Many A clever boss convinces their enforcers that it’s them against the world; that they can only trust each other (and the boss), and that everyone else is the enemy. Other enforcers, even those that work for other bosses, see you as “one of the good guys”. They will offer you shelter and loan you basic equipment, so long as doing so doesn’t put them in obvious danger. They will also overlook any crimes you commit, unless it’s particularly egregious or harms them or their bosses. Suggested Characteristics Enforcers are defined by a willingness to put the desires of their bosses ahead of their own beliefs. They tend to be loyal and efficient but also isolated and untrusting D8 Personality Trait 1 I get angry when people don’t listen to me. 2 When I’m not sleeping, eating, or fighting, I’m lifting weights or running laps. 3 I’m covered in scars and will happily recount the fights that earned each one. 4 People that can’t defend themselves disgust me, and I make no effort to hide it. 5 I struggle to make important decisions for myself. 6 It’s hard for me to trust anyone I haven’t fought alongside. 7 I don’t like being alone, especially out in the open. 8 I have an insatiable yearning for others’ respect. D6 Ideal 1 Camaraderie. I’ll do anything to protect my friends and I trust they feel the same way. (Good) 2 Legalism. Society is built on a code of laws and it’s our duty to always follow that code. (Lawful) 3 Ends Justify. If a goal is worth achieving, anything done to further that goal is permissible. (Chaotic) 4 Greed. I don’t care about “right” and “wrong”; I care about coming home to the nicest house. (Evil) 5 Obedience. Things go smoother when I just show up and do what I’m told. (Neutral) 6 Pragmatism. The world is a dangerous, messy place. I do what I must to survive. (Any) D6 Bond 1 My family depends on the money I bring home. 2 The officer that recruited me saved me from a life of poverty. 3 I hurt an innocent person, badly, and I need to make it right. 4 There’s another enforcer that is always there to bail me out when I screw up. 5 My family has served the boss for generations and I’m honored to follow in their footsteps. 6 There’s a little tavern I go to after every job. It’s the only place I feel at ease. D6 Flaw 1 If someone challenges me to a fight, I can’t say no. 2 I can’t stand being wrong and will lie, cheat, or bluster to save face. 3 I’ve buried my guilt for so long that I’m not sure what genuine remorse feels like. 4 An attack against my beliefs is an attack against me personally. 5 I view everyone around me as expendable and struggle to form meaningful relationships. 6 I implicitly trust authority figures even when anyone else would know something is wrong.

name: Executioner
description: You made a living from killing. Most criminals get away, so when they do catch them, those in charge like to make an example with a public spectacle. People weren’t exactly lining up for the job and most decent people understandably see this as undesirable work. You took to the work. Perhaps a forebear of yours, and one of their forebears before them had the job; and it has become a family profession. Perhaps it was an outlet for your darker desires that would have led you to the block. Skill Proficiencies: Intimidation, Medicine Tool Proficiencies: Your choice of dice or playing cards Languages: Thieves’ cant Equipment: A black hood, the tool you used for execution, a set of dice or playing cards that you took from a prisoner, an outfit stained with blood, a set of traveler’s clothes, a belt pouch containing 10 gp. Dark Reputation Because the job is so unseemly, you’ve spent your life living in the fringes of polite society; perhaps being forced to live outside the city. This social isolation led you to interacting with other outcasts to find friends. This has in turn meant your social circle includes lepers, prostitutes, and criminals that haven’t been caught or whose crimes aren’t severe enough to put them before you on a workday. This makes you even more of a pariah. Some executioners embrace their reputation, and revel in the fear that people have of them. They can sometimes use their position as a way to harm people and be able to avoid repercussions. D4 Dark Reputation 1 I executed an heir to the throne on the behest of their usurper, but the usurper was deposed and they called my actions a crime. 2 A moment of bloodlust led to me executing someone in a manner seen as too much and had me replaced by someone with more restraint. 3 As an apprentice, I was forced to practice on stray dogs to desensitize me. I kept it up after it was no longer expected. 4 The laws changed and my profession was seen as obsolete. Kindness was the new normal. Was it kindness to force me to retire? Being an executioner isn’t inherently evil, not all killing is murder after all (or at least, that’s what the people who hired you tell you). Some people come into the job like any other job, jobs need to be done and people need to work in order to make money to live. Sometimes though, the circumstances that arise from killing in the name of the state leads those with scruples away. Option: Righteous Resignation D4 Righteous Resignation 1 The people rose up against a tyrant and I was the one to kill them, but the loyalists retook power and now I am wanted. 2 A moment of hesitation during an execution led me being seen as inefficient and a liability in maintaining law and order. 3 As an apprentice, I was forced to practice on stray dogs to desensitize me. Killing people wasn’t difficult, but killing animals still pains me. 4 The laws of the land changed, favoring rehabilitation. I am relieved to be free from this burden. Feature: Inner Workings Within a settlement of sufficient size, you know whom to talk to and whom to ask to find out information about crime and punishment. Unless that information is intentionally being kept secret, you can always find out who is imprisoned, who is scheduled to die soon and also information about anyone who is currently wanted. People familiar with your background will volunteer this information just to get you to leave their presence sooner. Suggested Characteristics Executioners are often grim, whether in sense of humor, expression, or personality. Their sense of justice can also become skewed as part of their line of work, though whether it is stronger or weaker depends on the individual. D8 Personality Traits 1 I try to talk as little as possible, and when I do, I do not mince words. 2 I rarely smile, or show any outward emotion. 3 I prefer to let others make decisions for me, that way I have no blame when things go wrong. 4 Watching a person die hardly stirs me, but if someone harms an animal unnecessarily, watch out. 5 My speech is laden with foul language and impolite epithets. 6 Whenever I meet someone, I imagine what it would be like to execute them. 7 I find death to be humorous. When faced with death, I make terrible puns and bad jokes. 8 The apple doesn’t fall far from the tree, I will judge harshly and think poorly of people based on their parentage. D6 Ideals 1 Power. Life and death are most important when they are at my fingertips and within my control. (Evil) 2 Order. Laws are meant to be obeyed, it doesn’t matter if we think they are fair. (Lawful) 3 Apathy. If you don’t want to suffer the consequences, you shouldn’t commit crimes. (Neutral) 4 Retribution. The courts move too slowly, I know who is guilty and I should be able to punish people on my own. (Chaotic) 5 Redemption. Everyone should have a chance to make things right, my trade should be unnecessary. (Good) 6 Bloodlust. Nobody is innocent, nobody deserves forgiveness. (Evil) D6 Bonds 1 The one who taught me the trade was my first victim, I’ve never forgiven the one who ordered me to do so. 2 I have a child or sibling that I left behind, I hope to reunite with them someday. 3 I hope to someday, somehow, atone for the blood that is on my hands. 4 I once killed someone who was wearing a mask, legally, they had no name. I want to find out who they were. 5 I never want to see anyone forced to walk the same path as I have. The choice should not be taken lightly. 6 Someone was once pardoned right at the last minute, no doubt due to bribery. I vow to bring them to true justice. D6 Flaws 1 I drown myself in drink to dull the guilt of all the lives I’ve ended. 2 I genuinely enjoy killing, I enjoy it so much that it is hard to stop. 3 I’ve taken a bribe to fake an execution, certain members of the criminal underground know. 4 I’ve sold body parts to necromancers and other practitioners of the dark arts. 5 I obey legitimate authority, regardless of notions of “right or wrong”. 6 I don’t care if my macabre sense of humor makes others uncomfortable.

name: Exile
description: Sometimes seen as a fate worse than death, exile has long been a popular sanction for radicals, dissidents, and troublemakers. Exiling these people allows the authorities to remove a thorn from their sides without creating a martyr or having to keep the unwanted person in costly perpetual captivity. Many a coup or revolution has resulted in the leaders and courtiers of the old regime being consigned to exile, sometimes on a moon or neighboring planet, sometimes on the other side of the ‘verse. On occasion, a person may choose exile voluntarily, either as an alternative to something worse or because they desire time on the Frontier to grow and develop. An exile has a unique opportunity to absorb foreign cultures and contact émigré communities while rallying support remotely. Living in exile might provide benefits that aren't available back home, such as the freedom to pursue otherwise forbidden love interests or take advantage of more lenient tax policies, either of which could deliver the impetus to accept a self-imposed exile. Exiles take to adventuring for a number of reasons. For some, their exile was only temporary, and now they seek to embark on a dangerous journey home, while others might seek to foment rebellion in absentia so as to be welcomed as liberating heroes on their return. Some exiles are gripped by wanderlust, traveling the world with a small group of companions. The unluckiest of all, however, might find themselves unwelcome everywhere, with no choice other than to continue wandering forever. Skill Proficiencies: Deception, Survival Languages: Any two of your choice Equipment: A dagger, a small strongbox, a memento from your homeland, a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 5 gp Feature: Exile Network You keep in touch with a network of exiles and expatriates, who possess an eclectic mix of skills and the durable spirit of pioneers. If you need to find someone with an unusual or specialized skill (such as art forgery, translation of ancient languages, or poison-brewing), you likely know where to find them. Variant Feature: Radical Sympathizers As a prominent figurehead for a group of religious, political, or ethnic radicals, you are often able to find people who sympathize with your situation. When you employ hirelings, they may offer you better rates, fanatical loyalty, or enhanced services. Reason for Exile You were exiled for a reason. Choose a ‘crime’ or roll on the table below to determine why you were forced to leave your home. d10 Crime 1 Opposition to political rulers 2 Tax exile 3 Religious dissent/radicalism 4 Sentenced to exile for serious crime 5 Death sentence commuted to exile after committing capital crime 6 Forbidden love 7 Refugee displaced by war or disaster 8 Escaping shameful failures committed at home 9 Fleeing false accusations 10 Self-imposed exile/journey of self-discovery Suggested Characteristics Being exiled is a deeply painful experience, and life as a stateless persona non grata is extremely challenging. Such a trial is sure to leave some marks on the exile’s personality. d8 Personality Trait 1 I jump whenever anyone knocks on my door. 2 I stand by my principles, rather than compromising them. 3 Hand-written letters are my preferred means of communication. 4 I am fascinated by different cultures. 5 I sometimes become pensive and withdrawn. 6 I have a lot of interesting and unusual friends. 7 I often reminisce about my years before exile. 8 I write a lot of poetry in my spare time. d6 Ideal 1 Homecoming. I hope to return to my homeland one day. (Any) 2 Liberty. I will live the way I want to! (Chaotic) 3 Peace. I will make the most of my time in exile, living a peaceable life. (Lawful) 4 Leadership. It is on me to lead my people through the wilderness. (Good) 5 Revenge. I must take revenge on those who cast me out! (Evil) 6 Refuge. In these dangerous times, I must focus solely on survival. (Neutral) d6 Bond 1 I have made many good friends in the émigré community. 2 I still write to my family back home. 3 People count on me as a symbol of resistance. 4 I have started a new family in my adoptive homeland. 5 I cannot return home until I have found what I am looking for. 6 I am still wanted by the courts. d6 Flaw 1 I have trouble keeping my big mouth shut, and often end up ranting against my opponents. 2 I get in trouble with the law wherever I go. 3 I can’t seem to put down roots or form lasting connections anywhere. 4 My hatred for the people who exiled me sometimes crowds out reason in my head. 5 I prefer to work alone, and rarely seek compromise with others. 6 I’ve been away so long, I have lost touch with my family/culture/language.

name: Exile of the Black City
description: Misto Cherno, also known as the Black City, is the traveling fortress that serves as capital to the villains and bandits of the plains. The size of the city changes to match the overall health of the Rothenian lands. In times of strife, turmoil, and war, the city grows, adding wagons and walls to accommodate the increase. During times of peace, the city's population shrinks. It is said that once Misto Cherno consisted of just four walled wagons. As long as there are those with few scruples, the Black City rolls. You are from this villainous place. Your story before finding a home among the Khazzak and Kariv bandits is yours to decide. What events led you to take a place by the fires of Misto Cherno? What choice did you have? Were you born inside the wooden walls? Perhaps you were a captive, taken in a raid by foul-tempered centaurs who thought to sell you to slavers—or worse. Now, and perhaps just this very hour, you have been exiled from Misto Cherno. Whether your exile was self-imposed or decreed by the lord herself, you are no longer welcome in the city of bandits. Perhaps you felt called to some other purpose. Perhaps you found a god in the smoke and the callous laughter of thieves. What has changed your heart, such that banditry no longer suits it? This road will be long. Many will not trust you. The dark and twisting tendrils from your time in Misto Cherno will always seek you. Skill Proficiencies: Deception, Survival Tool Proficiencies: Thieves' tools, vehicles (land) Equipment: a set of traveler's clothes, a mule, two sacks containing a set of thieves' tools and 10 gp Feature: Know Evil Your time in the Black City left a mark on your spirit and your flesh. Dark deeds lie in your past, and you have a keen insight into the motivations of evil-aligned beings. Unless a creature's alignment is obscured by magical means, you know whether a creature's alignment is evil after interacting with it or for a minute or more. Also, you must choose the location on your body where the five-spoked wheel was branded into your flesh. Showing the mark to bandits, criminals, burglars, thieves, and other unsavory types (GM's discretion) grants you advantage on Charisma checks when dealing with them, but good folk are likely to turn against you if your past is revealed. Suggested Characteristics Exiles of the Black City have rejected their nefarious past. They strive toward redemption or anonymity in the general population. d6 Personality Traits 1 I don't often judge. 2 I am patient with those who express regret for their wrongdoing. 3 I am guarded and keep my feelings to myself. 4 I have a gallows' sense of humor, and respect the choices of others. 5 I am slow to express sympathy for the suffering of others. 6 My heart is hard, and little love is found in it. d6 Ideal 1 Forgiveness. I seek forgiveness for the wrongs I have done, and support others who do the same (Good). 2 Social Contract. Too late did I see the value of organized society, but I now value the unspoken rules of civilized folk (Lawful). 3 Might. In dark times, strength is the only important quality. (Evil). 4 Privacy. I value my right to privacy and keep out of other people's business (any). 5 Nihilism. I have seen the dark heart of mortals and have little regard for their plans and intentions (Chaotic). 6 Purpose. I have found a greater purpose in my life and pursue it at any cost (any). d6 Bond 1 I will have revenge upon those who organized my exile. Misto Cherno will burn. 2 I reject villainy—so long as I am present, none will be bullied or oppressed. 3 Power and riches will be mine; I will rise in station and tower over those who betrayed me. 4 My exile is a blessing and a gift. I will cleanse others of their evil so that they too might be delivered. 5 I must flee the Rothenian Plain, and abandon my former self, becoming an entirely different person. 6 One day, I will return to Misto Cherno and take over its rulership. d6 Flaw 1 I overcompensate for my evil past. 2 I almost never trust others, even those who are close and deserving. 3 I am prone to bouts of extreme violence when stressed—these displays may shock others. 4 I am often tempted by the quick rewards of criminal behavior. 5 Money is often enough to earn my allegiance. 6 I have trouble working in a team, and struggle to form relationships.

name: Expanse Immigrant
description: Expanse Immigrant “No one’s ever going to drive me from my home again.” You’ve arrived in the Expanse hoping for a better life. You may have come to seek fortunes you never had, opportunities you were never given, or a peace you never knew. Regardless of the reason, you’ve endured hardship to reach the Expanse, and intend to make this wondrous place your home. Skill Proficiencies: Perception, Survival Tool Proficiencies: type of artisan’s tools Languages: One of your choice Equipment: A keepsake from where you grew up, a set of traveling clothes, one set of artisan’s tool, and a belt pouch containing 10 gp Bonus Trait: Inured to the Elements Officer Progression: If you use the optional Seafarer Advancement Rules (see chapter 7), you increase your officer station rank by one in your choice of boatswain or cook Feature: Survivor’s Scrabble You overcame many challenges, enduring a difficult journey to reach the Aetherial Expanse. You learned how to survive under the most difficult conditions and have started to build a life for yourself beside the Silvery Seas. You have advantage on Survival checks to gather food and water, and to understand environmental threats. Suggested Characteristics Expanse Immigrants are tough folk who don’t give up easily. Many are stoic, having endured numerous hardships, though others relied on their cheery dispositions to pull through tough times. They’re inclined to be protective of things they care about, as most have lost things of value to reach the Expanse. Personality Trait d8 Personality 1 I always find the silver lining, no matter how terrible the situation. 2 I’ve seen just about everything on my travels. Nothing can surprise me. 3 The Expanse is a magical, wondrous place. I want to experience all of it! 4 I still look over my shoulder, wondering if the troubles I fled have followed me here. 5 The gods must have blessed me for me to have found this place. 6 Planning is a waste of time. Taking action is all that matters. 7 I hold on to anything of value. I’ve already lost so much. 8 I find new people fascinating and can talk for hours with everyone I meet. Ideal d6 Ideal 1 Community. Caring for each other is how we overcome strife and hardship. 2 Independence. Here I am free. No one tells me what to do. 3 Perseverance. I never quit. Every setback pushes me to try harder. 4 Honor. The only sure thing is that I will always keep my promises. 5 Ambition. Now that I am in the Expanse, I will achieve greatness. 6 Might. My strength lets me overcome obstacles in my way. Bond d6 Bond 1 Someone sacrificed everything so that I could come here. I won’t let them down. 2 A kind stranger helped me in a time of need. I am to do the same for someone else. 3 I fled my home because I spoke out against tyranny. I will fight against it wherever I go. 4 I was once desperately poor. I will always help those in need. 5 I came to enact vengeance on someone who fled to the Expanse. 6 I will protect my companions with my life. Flaw d6 Flaw 1 I’m bitterly jealous of anyone who has more than I do. 2 I can’t trust anyone, not even those I love. 3 I’m quick to anger and won’t tolerate any kind of disrespect. 4 I’m deathly afraid of the creature that nearly killed me. 5 I abandoned a loved one to a terrible fate. 6 I am always right, and no one can change my thinking.

name: Experimented
description: Blood experiment is a common practice in Kanrath and Cyherested although they differ in each city. In Kanrath, the most common blood practice is leech therapy, where the scientists or the state officials drain “the dirty’’ blood and replace it with a more “clean” and “pure” one. It has little to no scientific accuracy but it is believed that it reveals powers that lie in one’s blood or that it provides the experimented with new powers related to blood. Most leech therapy victims die due to blood loss or the fact that their bodies cannot withstand the change in their blood. Cyherested is famous for its blood treatments, where multiple alchemical compounds are transferred into the experimented’s blood to reveal one’s sorcery abilities. The duration of the process varies. It can take hours or it can take months. What both practices have in common is the pain inflicted on the experimented, and the trauma experienced by the victims. You are an experimented; you’ve somehow lived through blood practices, or fled during the process. You may be a victim of blood practice or you may have wanted to have it done on your own. Skill Proficiencies: Medicine and one other skill of your choice Tool Proficiencies: Healer’s kit Equipment: A bag containing the details of your experiment, a set of common clothes, and a pouch containing 100 KF/CS Feature: Know Thy Enemy You understand the operational systems of the blood experiment mechanisms as you’ve spent time being a victim of one. You must make a DC 20 Intelligence check to remember the exact machinations of a blood experiment. You can operate a blood experiment mechanism on a success. Suggested Characteristics You keep your distance from the scientists and the state officials who were responsible for your pain in the first place. The pain you endured has given you lots of traumas that you try to overcome. You are extra careful around people because you find them to be inherently untrustworthy. d8 Personality Trait 1 I cannot shake off that I almost died. 2 I want to live out the rest of my life on my own. 3 I don’t like making small talk, what’s the point anyway? 4 Worldly pleasures make no sense to me anymore. 5 I try to find a cause in my life. 6 I am constantly in a state of sadness. 7 I seek ways of empowering myself further. 8 Watching others in pain triggers me. d6 Ideal 1 Unstoppable. I want to have more blood experiments done, as they can make me stronger. (Any) 2 Vengeful. I want to kill all scientists and officials who take part in the blood experiments. (Chaotic) 3 Healer. I want to find ways of helping the victims of blood experiments. (Good) 4 Patient. I seek ways of curing my traumas. (Neutral) 5 Curious. I must understand if blood experiments have given me powers or not. (Neutral) 6 Altruistic. Why not use blood experiments for the greater good? (Chaotic) d6 Bond 1 I will fight those who messed with my blood without my permission. 2 There was a scientist who helped me escape, I must find them. 3 This city is where I belong, I must help its citizens; they don’t deserve to undergo the pain I went through. 4 A friend of mine died during blood experiments, and I still mourn this loss. 5 I am stronger now, and the world must know it. 6 I must spread the word about the realities of blood experiments so that other people can be wary. d6 Flaw 1 My skin got paler, people sometimes confuse me with pale ones . 2 I stutter while speaking, I didn’t used to… not before the experiment. 3 I have physical wounds that do not heal. 4 I get into a frenzied state of mind when I see someone who practices blood experiments. 5 I want more blood experiments done on me to make me unstoppable, but it’s started to take a toll on my mental wellbeing. 6 I have post-traumatic stress disorder due to the experiments.
book: Bloodpunk - A Guide to Tolia Campaign Setting

name: Faceless
description: Being who you are, you could never be a hero. Whether due to your class, your people, your family, or your sins, something about you prevents you from effectively pursuing the path you’ve chosen. Even so, that doesn’t stop you. You’ve left your old face behind, taking on a new persona, becoming something more. Characters with the faceless background don a disguise—literally or otherwise—as they adventure. This persona might be dramatic or subtle. In a way, though, many characters have such larger than life personalities. Therefore, this background largely focuses on detailing the hero behind the mask. Skill Proficiencies: Deception, Intimidation Tool Proficiencies: Disguise kit Languages: One of your choice Equipment: A disguise kit, a costume, a pouch containing 10 gp Faceless Persona A faceless character adventures behind the mask of a public persona. This persona is as natural to them as their hidden, true face, but it disguises their identity. Roll on the Faceless Persona table to determine your persona, or work with the DM to create a persona that’s unique to your character and suits the tone of your game. Faceless Persona d10 Persona 1 A flamboyant spy or brigand 2 The incarnation of a nation or people 3 A scoundrel with a masked guise 4 A vengeful spirit 5 The manifestation of a deity or your faith 6 One whose beauty is greatly accented using makeup 7 An impersonation of another hero 8 The embodiment of a school of magic 9 A warrior with distinctive armor 10 A disguise with animalistic or monstrous characteristics, meant to inspire fear Feature: Dual Personalities Most of your fellow adventurers and the world know you as your persona. Those who seek to learn more about you—your weaknesses, your origins, your purpose—find themselves stymied by your disguise. Upon donning a disguise and behaving as your persona, you are unidentifiable as your true self. By removing your disguise and revealing your true face, you are no longer identifiable as your persona. This allows you to change appearances between your two personalities as often as you wish, using one to hide the other or serve as convenient camouflage. However, should someone realize the connection between your persona and your true self, your deception might lose its effectiveness. Suggested Characteristics A faceless character usually plays their persona—the hero or extraordinary person they are every day. That’s all a facade, though, or a part of them expressed to an extreme. To define a persona, feel free to choose characteristics from other backgrounds, particularly folk hero, hermit, or noble. For the person behind the persona, the one who truly strives to be faceless, consider a distinct set of faceless characteristics. As a result, those with this background have two sets of characteristics, one for their persona, and one for their faceless selves. Faceless Personality Traits d8 Personality Traits 1 I’m earnest and uncommonly direct. 2 I strive to have no personality—it’s easier to forget what’s hardly there. 3 I treasure a memento of the person or instance that set me upon my path. 4 I sleep just as much as I need to and on an unusual schedule. 5 I think far ahead, a detachedness often mistaken for daydreaming. 6 I cultivate a single obscure hobby or study and eagerly discuss it at length. 7 I am ever learning how to be among others—when to stay quiet, when to laugh. 8 I behave like an extreme opposite of my persona. Faceless Ideals d6 Ideal 1 Justice. Place in society shouldn’t determine one’s access to what is right. (Good) 2 Security. Doing what must be done can’t bring the innocent to harm. (Lawful) 3 Confusion. Deception is a weapon. Strike from where your foes won’t expect. (Chaotic) 4 Infamy. My name will be a malediction, a curse that fulfills my will. (Evil) 5 Incorruptibility. Be a symbol, and leave your flawed being behind. (Any) 6 Anonymity. It’s my deeds that should be remembered, not their instrument. (Any) Faceless Bonds d6 Bond 1 I do everything for my family. My first thought is keeping them safe. 2 What I do, I do for the world. The people don’t realize how much they need me. 3 I’ve seen too many in need. I must not fail them as everyone else has. 4 I stand in opposition, less the wicked go unopposed. 5 I am exceptional. I do this because no one else can, and no one can stop me. 6 I do everything for those who were taken from me. Faceless Flaws d6 Flaw 1 I am callous about death. It comes to us all eventually. 2 I never make eye contact or hold it unflinchingly. 3 I have no sense of humor. Laughing is uncomfortable and embarrassing. 4 I overexert myself, sometimes needing to recuperate for a day or more. 5 I think far ahead, a detachedness often mistaken for daydreaming. 6 I see morality entirely in black and white.
